definition: strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: He confirmed his decree to Jacob, to Israel his eternal covenant.
sentences.chinese: 爲雅各伯立爲不移的規條，向以色列立爲永遠的盟約。

sentences.english: Landlords and tenants are bound by the lease and rules.
sentences.chinese: 房東和房客要互守租約和規條。

sentences.english: The Chinese people have always respected the dignity and worth of human beings.
sentences.chinese: 尊重一個人就是接受他的信念，價值觀和規條。

sentences.english: Boring or routine tasks can create a lot of procrastination and low-level anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 枯燥及規條性的任務造成很多的拖延和低層次的焦慮。

sentences.english: I confirm that I/ the participant has read through and will adhere to the Rules and Regulations of Lunch and Pandas Programme.
sentences.chinese: 參加者已詳閱及會遵守熊貓午餐會活動之守則及規條。

sentences.english: Many people see the Ten Commandments merely as rules that govern our behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 在很多人的眼中，十誡只是一些規條。

sentences.english: I confirm that I/ the participant has read through and will adhere to the Rules and Regulations of Breakfast and Pandas Programme.
sentences.chinese: 參加者已詳閱及會遵守熊貓早餐會活動之守則及規條。

definition: to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
